pr_title: Add plan check for runtime optimization

timeline.bodyText: We shouldn't have a seperate runtime planchecker, since the runtime plan has the same requirements as the "final" plan. Instead, we should be running the planchecker for the final stage after doing runtime optimization
timeline.author: rschlussel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -74,6 +74,9 @@ public PlanChecker(FeaturesConfig featuresConfig, boolean forceSingleNode)
                         new VerifyProjectionLocality(),
                         new DynamicFiltersChecker(),
                         new WarnOnScanWithoutPartitionPredicate(featuresConfig))
+                .putAll(
+                        Stage.RUNTIME,

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline. We do not want to modify any existing checks in the FINAL and FRAGMENT stages, but there are problems for using each of the two stage to carry out runtime checking (e.g. FINAL is targeting a whole plan, FRAGMENT is generic whereas the streaming property check is specific to fragments with their exchange sources materialized). So decide to add a RUNTIME stage and copy all necessary checks into this stage. Future runtime checks around exchange materialized stages will also go into this new category.
replies.author: pguofb

replies.bodyText: sorry, been thinking about this again.  is there a way to make this check in the "fragment" section, but for it to only run if the plan has a tablescan stage.  Because the check isn't specific to anything that happens at runtime, it's just that runtime optimization happens to only involve certain kinds of fragments
replies.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: This plan checker is too specific to a particular optimizer rule.  PlanCheckers should be enforcing general requirements for a valid plan regardless of what optimizers ran.
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline. The naming is changed to reflect its actual purpose.
replies.author: pguofb

timeline.message:
Invoke runtime plan checker in SqlQueryScheduler

- Add a ValidateRuntimeSwappedJoin check rule to planChecker that
specifically investigate if the probe and build side of a join node
satisfies required distribution properties.
- Add a new category (RUNTIME) in planChecker that will be invoked by
SqlQueryScheduler after runtime optimizations on each stage.

Invoke runtime plan checker in SqlQueryScheduler

- Add a ValidateStreamingJoins check rule to planChecker that
specifically investigate if the probe and build side of a join node
satisfies required streaming properties.
- Invoke planChecker to check each fragment that is runtime optimized.

Bypass fragment sanityCheck for TestCostCalculator

TestCostCalculator tests create a lot of mock plans that are all
single-staged and without proper exchanges in it. This will break
fragment sanity checks while building fragmentedPlans. Instead,
extract the statsAndConsts generation logic here to bypass unnecessary
fragment generation logic and sanity checks.

timeline.bodyText: I worry about this because then we won't know if this feature breaks.  I think we should let it fail instead, or at least have a test mode that we let fail and turn on for all our tests (similar to ignore-stats-calculator-failures)
timeline.author: rschlussel

replies.bodyText: Sure, let's just have it fail instead.
replies.author: pguofb

timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: error message shouldn't mention runtime swapped join
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.bodyText: error message shouldn't mention runtime swapped join
timeline.author: rschlussel

timeline.message:
Bypass fragment sanityCheck for TestCostCalculator

TestCostCalculator tests create a lot of mock plans that are all
single-staged and without proper exchanges in it. This will break
fragment sanity checks while building fragmentedPlans. Instead,
extract the statsAndConsts generation logic here to bypass unnecessary
fragment generation logic and sanity checks.

Invoke runtime plan checker in SqlQueryScheduler

- Add a ValidateStreamingJoins check rule to planChecker that
specifically investigate if the probe and build side of a join node
satisfies required streaming properties.
- Invoke planChecker to check each fragment that is runtime optimized.
- Bypass fragment sanityCheck for TestCostCalculator

satisfies required streaming properties.
- Invoke planChecker to check each fragment that is runtime optimized.
- Bypass fragment sanityCheck for TestCostCalculator

Refactor RuntimeReorderJoin use PropertyDerivation

- Refactor the add/skip local exchange logic in RuntimeReorderJoins
to use the same checking as AddLocalExchange, namely the
StreamPropertyDervations.
- Check if the probe side is valid when removing unnecessary local
exchange.
- Check if the build side needs an additional local exchange.
